identificationModule.briefTitle: Use of Virtual Reality and Video Games in the Physiotherapy Treatment of Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Use of Virtual Reality and Video Games in the Physiotherapy Treatment of Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Randomized clinical trial based on the application of virtual reality and video games together with physiotherapy treatment in stroke patients, with the main objective of determining their beneficial effects.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: 21 participants who will be divided by randomization between a control group and an experimental group. The results will be quantified with the following scales: Modified Asworth (spasticity). Daniels et al (muscle strength) Tinetti (balance and gait) Berg (balance) Joint range

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Two randomized groups. A control group and an experimental group.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Randomized groups. Participants do not know to which group they are assigned. The other participants are unaware of the purpose of the study.

armGroups.label: Experimental group
armGroups.description: Conventional neurological physiotherapy treatment with the use of virtual reality and video games.
interventionNames: Other: Virtual reality and video games

interventions.name: Virtual reality and video games
interventions.description: Use of a software in stroke patients' rehabilitation.

interventions.name: Neurological physiotherapy
interventions.description: Application of conventional physical therapy techniques.

primaryOutcomes.description: Strength measurement using the Daniels and Worthingham Scale. Minimum value = 0 , maximum value = 5. Higher scores mean a better outcome.
Spasticity measurement using the Ashworth modified scale. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 4. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.
Gait measurement using the Tinetti scale. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 28. Higher scores mean a better outcome.
Balance using the Berg Balance Scale. Minimum value = 0, maximum value = 56. Higher scores mean a better outcome.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients receiving neurological physiotherapy treatment.
* Patients who have suffered a stroke in the last two years.
* Patients with an age range between 18 and 80 years old.
* Patients with stroke with the ability to have minimal manual pressure with one limb.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with stroke who also have degenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's or Parkinson's.
* Stroke patients who do not understand the instructions.
* Patients who have undergone surgery on the evaluated limbs.
* Patients with scars that limit movement.
